means: 出版( publish的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He will have been heartened by the telephone opinion poll published yesterday.
sentence.Network_cn: 他会为昨天公布的电话民意调查结果感到鼓舞。

sentence.Network_en: The material consisted only of already published, unclassified information.
sentence.Network_cn: 这份材料里只有一些已公开的、非保密性质的信息。

sentence.Network_en: In 1987 Congressional Quarterly published a series of guidebooks to American politics.
sentence.Network_cn: 1987年《国会季刊》出版了一系列美国政治指南读物。

字典中揭字的解释 ... (4) 肩负;担;扛[ carry] (6) 披露;发表;公布[ announce; publish; disclose] (8) 掀起; 拿开[ take off].

entry.def: When a company publishes a book or magazine, it prints copies of it, which are sent to shops to be sold.

example.ex: His latest book of poetry will be published by Faber in May.
example.tran: 他的最新诗集将由菲贝尔出版公司于5月出版。

entry.def: When the people in charge of a newspaper or magazine publish a piece of writing or a photograph, they print it in their newspaper or magazine.

example.ex: The ban was imposed after the magazine published an article satirising the government...
example.tran: 这家杂志刊登了一篇讽刺政府的文章后被停刊。

example.ex: I don't encourage people to take photographs like this without permission, but by law we can publish.
example.tran: 我不鼓励人们未经允许就拍摄这样的照片，但根据法律我们可以刊登。

entry.def: If someone publishes a book or an article that they have written, they arrange to have it published.

example.ex: John Lennon found time to publish two books of his humorous prose.
example.tran: 约翰·列侬抽时间出版了两本幽默散文。

entry.def: If you publish information or an opinion, you make it known to the public by having it printed in a newspaper, magazine, or official document.

example.ex: The demonstrators called on the government to publish a list of registered voters.
example.tran: 游行者呼吁政府公布注册选民的名单。

means.word_mean: 1. prepared and printed for distribution and sale;

auth_sentence.content: Their study is published in the Journal of Neuroscience.
auth_sentence.res_content: Their study is published in the Journal of Neuroscience.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Their study is published in the Journal of Neuroscience.

auth_sentence.content: The findings are published in the journal Scientific Reports.
auth_sentence.res_content: The findings are published in the journal Scientific Reports.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The findings are published in the journal Scientific Reports.

auth_sentence.content: The research is published in the journal Conservation Letters.
auth_sentence.res_content: The research is published in the journal Conservation Letters.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The research is published in the journal Conservation Letters.

Sentence.sentence: Perhaps it will become the mark of an author to reckon with that he or she is still published in hard copy.
Authors still published in printed versions will be considered important ones

Researchers in Canada just published a study in the journal Psychological Science that says trying to get people to think more positively can actually have the opposite effect: it can simply highlight how unhappy they are.
In a paper published recently, Kapur applied the principle of productive failure to mathematical problem solving in three schools.
What was Wheatley forced to do to get her book published?
This means, of course, that almost all of the books published in the 20th century are still under copyright – and the last century saw more books published than in all previous centuries combined.
